title: Handwritten B
content:
I am trying to identify the font I used to create a logo for my website ( [http://kickert.info/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621104404/http:/kickert.info/ "http://kickert.info/")) several years ago. I know I used two different fonts and have already identified the first one. Here is what I know:

I first used it 3-5 years ago.  
I distinctly remember using a font categorized as "handwriting"

I would love an exact match, but if that is not possible, I am looking for a font that:  
-has a larger upper bowl  
-crosses over the stem at all three junctures  
-has rough edges instead of smooth  
-has a comparable slope

Thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621104404im_/http:/typophile.com/files/binquestion_5116.gif)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [binquestion.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621104404/http:/typophile.com/files/binquestion_0.gif) | 2.4 KB |
author: kickert

comments.content: That looks like a Rage K with an altered B.
The K in my logo is in fact Rage Italic but the "B" is from another font and I am not sure which one. I am positive I did not alter the letter, just used different fonts.
Did you slant and heavy up [Mistral](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621104404/http:/www.identifont.com/show?RS) aka Staccato 222?

I think you nailed it with Mistral. Looking at my logo vs. the gif I uploaded it is definitely heavied up. Pretty sure I ended up with the font and the drop shadow merged together in that file.

You guys are good!

Thanks alot.
